    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The highly anticipated clash between Borussia Dortmund and Schalke kicked off with Schalke starting proceedings in what turned out to be an electrifying contest at Signal Iduna Park. Right from the start, it was clear that the tension and stakes of this derby would lead to a highly contested affair.

Within the very first minute of play, Schalke committed a foul, providing Dortmund with an indirect free-kick, quickly setting the tone for a match marred by frequent stoppages and physical play. The early moments were packed with minor disruptionsâ€”throw-ins and fouls that interrupted the flow of the game repeatedly. Dortmund took the initiative, gaining the first corner at around the 1:37 mark. However, Schalke responded firmly, managing successive throw-ins and clearances that kept Dortmund from taking an early lead.

Around the 10th minute, Schalke began to assert a bit more control with several throw-ins that tested Dortmund's resilience. By the 18th minute, Schalke managed their first shot, though it was off target, serving as a warning sign to Dortmund that the visitors were capable of turning the game in their favor if given any space.

Shortly after, during a period of relatively balanced play, Dortmund regained possession leading up to the 21st minute. An indirect free-kick by Schalke following a foul on them was cleared by Dortmund effectively. The momentary lapse in concentration from Schalke allowed Dortmund to press forward, resulting in several attacking attempts that culminated in a corner around the 27th minute.

During this period, a frenzied succession of plays saw Dortmund come close to scoring multiple times. Their persistence paid off when they finally found the back of the net in the 29th minute, courtesy of a well-placed shot after a sequence of calculated passes and strategic moviements, putting the home side ahead. This opening goal put Dortmund in the driverâ€™s seat and forced Schalke to chase the game.

Schalkeâ€™s response was rapid, and just a couple of minutes after resuming play from kick-off, they launched an attack that saw them net an equalizer in the 32nd minute. Both sides displayed commendable attacking prowess, constantly threatening each otherâ€™s goal and ensuring that game stayed on a knife-edge.

The intensity of the derby resumed with increased fervor post the equalizer as Dortmund continued probing Schalkeâ€™s defense while Schalke attempted to exploit any counter-attacking opportunities. Both sides exchanged chances with shots both on and off target. Dortmund, however, regained their one-goal lead in the dying moments of the first half when one of their precise attacks resulted in another well-taken goal at the 42nd minute.

As the halftime whistle blew, Dortmund led Schalke with the scoreline reading 2-1, both sets of supporters eagerly anticipating the second half given the frantic pace and unpredictable nature of the first 45 minutes.

The second half began with Dortmund in possession, and Schalke immediately set the tone with a physical foul within the first minute, earning themselves a yellow card. Dortmund sought to capitalize on the ensuing free-kick, producing a shot that went wide. Still, the early stages of the second half demonstrated the home side's intent to extend their lead and secure the outcome in their favor.

Dortmundâ€™s continued pressure bore fruit soon after when they added to their tally, scoring their third goal in the 2nd minute of the second half. A quick transition from defense to attack allowed them to find space and fire a shot on target, further increasing their advantage. This goal was enough to stir Schalke, and the visitors and the game saw an immediate uptick in its tempo.

Schalke, trailing by two goals now, didnâ€™t back down and attempted a quick response. The game saw a flurry of activity including constant throw-ins, fouls, and clearances marking the robustness of both defenses even while attacking intent was clearly evident. 

Substitutions began around the 10th minute of the second half, signaling Schalkeâ€™s need to change strategies to overturn the deficit. Schalkeâ€™s persistence bore fruit when, around the halfway mark of the second half, they reduced the deficit to one goal with a sharp finish, making the scoreline 3-2. The excitement amongst the fans was palpable as the renewed hope for Schalke's comeback infused fresh energy into the game.

As the game progressed, both teams showed signs of fatigue but not without moments of attacking brilliance. Shots on target from both sides kept the goalkeepers on their toes, maintaining the spectators at the edge of their seats. Dortmund continued to seek another goal to secure their lead, while Schalke found themselves thwarted by effective defensive displays by the home side.

In the final moments of the game, both managers utilized their bench in a bid to inject fresh legs and shore up their respective strategies. Yellow cards became frequent as desperation on Schalkeâ€™s part to equalize grew more intense, while Dortmund sought to maintain composure and see out the game with their lead intact.

The tension reached its zenith in the closing stages, with Dortmund resisting consistently while creating occasional counter-attack opportunities. Schalkeâ€™s appeals for fouls and free-kicks increased, but Dortmundâ€™s disciplined approach minimized any costly errors. 

The match concluded with a myriad of throw-ins and strategic stoppages, cementing Dortmundâ€™s 3-2 victory in a hard-fought derby that saw passions flare and skilled play abound. Dortmund displayed a comprehensive attacking game backed by a resilient defense, whereas Schalke came just short despite their spirited efforts. 

This clash will be remembered for its high-tempo exchanges, defensive doggedness, and the relentless endeavor by both sides to take control at various points of the match. Dortmund's victory not only came from their clinical finishing but also from their ability to absorb pressure and execute defensive strategies when needed, making it a memorable derby clash with the final whistle marking jubilation for the home supporters and lingering hopes of improvement for the visitors.
